questions.text: A student takes some tablets she is offered at a disco, and without asking what they are she swallows them. A short time later she starts to hyperventilate and becomes very hot. What is the most likely action of the tablets she has taken?

options.label: A
options.text: An inhibitor of mitochondrial ATP synthesis

options.label: B
options.text: An inhibitor of the transport of ADP into mitochondria to be phosphorylated

options.label: C
options.text: An inhibitor of the transport of ATP out of mitochondria into the cytosol

options.label: D
options.text: An uncoupler of mitochondrial electron transport and oxidative phosphorylation

questions.correct_answer: D. An uncoupler of mitochondrial electron transport and oxidative phosphorylation
questions.explanation: Ans. D) An uncoupler of mitochondrial electron transport and oxidative phosphorylation

questions.text: A 35-year-old individual who consumed fast food from a street vendor for several days recently comes to a hospital with continuous vomiting over the last 36 hours. Despite not being able to eat or drink much, the patient's blood glucose levels remain stable. Which organ has played the primary role in maintaining this individual's blood glucose level in this duration?

A medical student studying biochemistry is reviewing the metabolic pathways of amino acids and their respective products. She learns that certain amino acids serve as precursors for biologically important compounds. For example, one amino acid is the precursor for neurotransmitters like norepinephrine, while another is converted into melatonin, a hormone regulating sleep-wake cycles. Match the amino acids below with their corresponding products: Amino Acids: A. Tyrosine B. Tryptophan C. Glycine D. Histidine Products: Melatonin Glutathione Norepinephrine Histamine
Malate Aspartate shuttle is required for
Which one of the following tissues can metabolize glucose, fatty acids, and ketone bodies for ATP production?
Inulin like fructans are used as prebiotics as they are non digestable. Resistance to digestion in the upper GI tract results from:

options.label: A
options.text: Absence of digestive enzymes in the upper GI tract.

questions.correct_answer: B. Beta configuration of anomeric C2
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Beta configuration of anomeric C2

questions.text: A patient of aldolase b deficiency was seen in the OPD. Feeding of which of the following substance will cause hypoglycemia in the patient?

A 3-year-old boy presents to the outpatient clinic with a swollen abdomen and failure to thrive. On examination, his liver is palpable 4 cm below the right costal margin, and he has a doll-like face with chubby cheeks. Laboratory investigations reveal fasting hypoglycemia, lactic acidosis, and hyperuricemia. A liver biopsy demonstrates increased glycogen storage with normal structure. Which enzyme deficiency is most likely responsible for this patient's clinical presentation?

A 3-year-old girl presents with progressive muscle weakness, myopathy and hepatomegaly. Upon investigation, a skeletal muscle biopsy reveals abnormal glycogen accumulation with very long outer branches. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis for this patient’s condition?

A 5-day-old neonate presents with lethargy, poor feeding, persistent vomiting, and seizures. On examination, the baby is hypotonic with a peculiar maple syrup-like odor in the urine. Blood investigations reveal metabolic acidosis with elevated levels of branched-chain amino acids (leucine, isoleucine, and valine) in plasma. A DNPH test performed on the urine is positive. Which enzyme is most likely deficient in this condition?
Following enzymes are involved in gluconeogenesis except:
Production of fructose in seminal fluid is:

options.label: B
options.text: Glucose 6 PO 4 → Sorbitol PO 4 → fructose PO 4 → fructose

questions.text: In glycolysis, inorganic phosphate is used in reactions catalysed by?
As one molecule of NADH is oxidized via the respiratory chain:

options.label: A
options.text: 1.5 molecules of ATP are produced in total.

options.label: B
options.text: 1 molecule of ATP is produced as electrons pass through complex IV.

options.label: C
options.text: 1 molecule of ATP is produced as electrons pass through complex II.

options.label: D
options.text: 1 molecule of ATP is produced as electrons pass through complex III.

questions.correct_answer: D. 1 molecule of ATP is produced as electrons pass through complex III.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) 1 molecule of ATP is produced as electrons pass through complex III.

questions.text: A 58-year-old woman with breast cancer presents with confusion, headaches, and persistent nausea. To evaluate for metastases to the brain, the oncologist orders a positron emission tomography (PET) scan, which covalently links a radioactive isotope to glucose and reveals highly active areas in the body (e.g., a tumor). Which of the following proteins enables the tracer to remain in the cell?
Which of the following metabolic intermediate involved in glycolysis, gluconeogenesis and glycogenolysis?

A 3-month-old infant, who was experiencing seizures, was diagnosed with a GLUT1 deficiency, resulting in reduced glucose uptake into the brain. As a result, which one of the following substrates was providing energy for the brain?

A 22-year-old soldier collapses from dehydration during maneuvers in the desert and is sent to a military hospital. Prior to enlisting, a physician observed a high level of glucose in his urine during an examination. At first, he was not allowed to enlist because he was suspected of having diabetes. However, further tests determined that his insulin level was normal. A glucose tolerance test exhibited a normal pattern. Laboratory tests following his dehydration episode repeat the previous findings, but further testing of the urine reveals that only d-glucose is elevated. Other sugars were not elevated. This patient's elevated urinary glucose and his dehydration episode are caused by a deficiency in which of the following?
The sugar NOT having free aldehyde or ketone group
Glucaric acid is formed from glucose by ?

options.label: D
options.text: Oxidation of both aldehyde carbon and primary alcoholic group

questions.correct_answer: D. Oxidation of both aldehyde carbon and primary alcoholic group
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Oxidation of both aldehyde carbon and primary alcoholic group

questions.text: A young man entered his physician's office complaining of bloating and diarrhea. His eyes were sunken, and the physician noted additional signs of dehydration. The patient's temperature was normal. He explained that the episode had occurred following a birthday party at which he had participated in an ice cream-eating contest. The patient reported prior episodes of a similar nature following ingestion of a significant amount of dairy products. This clinical scenario is most probably due to a deficiency in the activity of:

A 3-year-old boy presents to the emergency room after having a generalized tonic-clonic seizure. The child has a history of epilepsy, ataxia, and lactic acidosis. When questioned, the parents state that their child was born with a rare metabolic disease, pyruvate carboxylase deficiency. Which one of the following metabolites is this child unable to produce effectively?

An 8-year-old boy is seen by an ophthalmologist for vision difficulties, and the physician notices a slowing of the boy's eye movements. The ophthalmologist finds ophthalmoplegia and pigmentary retinopathy and suspects the child has Kearns-Sayre syndrome. Assuming that the defect in this disorder is due to a mutation in complex II of the ETC, electron transfer from which substrate would be impaired?
Which reaction in the figure below occurs in both muscle and liver but has substantially different qualities in the two?

A patient is undergoing a stress response due to hypoglycemia. The hormones epinephrine and glucagon are released to maintain blood glucose levels. Which of the following best describes their effect on glycogen metabolism in the liver?

options.label: A
options.text: Glycogen phosphorylase is activated, and glycogen synthase is activated simultaneously to ensure balanced glucose levels.

options.label: B
options.text: Glycogen phosphorylase is phosphorylated and active, while glycogen synthase is phosphorylated and inactive, promoting glycogen breakdown.

options.label: C
options.text: Both glycogen phosphorylase and glycogen synthase are dephosphorylated, promoting glycogen synthesis and storage.

options.label: D
options.text: Phosphorylation of glycogen synthase by cAMP-dependent protein kinase increases its activity, favoring glycogen synthesis.

questions.correct_answer: B. Glycogen phosphorylase is phosphorylated and active, while glycogen synthase is phosphorylated and inactive, promoting glycogen breakdown.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Glycogen phosphorylase is phosphorylated and active, while glycogen synthase is phosphorylated and inactive, promoting glycogen breakdown.

questions.text: A 25-year-old male presents with anemia and is suspected of having a red blood cell (RBC) enzymatic defect. You are evaluating the metabolic capacity of mature RBCs. Which of the following enzymes or components would NOT be found in mature RBCs?
In the figure below, which letter designates a reaction that may be catalyzed by different enzymes in different tissues, playing an important role in regulation of serum glucose levels?

A 4-year-old boy of middle eastern ancestry is known to have inherited favism, a sensitivity to fava beans due to glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency. Which of the following indicates the primary pathway affected by this deficiency and the pathway secondarily affected?

options.label: B
options.text: Pentose phosphate pathway, fatty acid oxidation

options.label: C
options.text: Citric acid cycle, Pentose phosphate pathway

questions.correct_answer: A. Pentose phosphate pathway, Cholesterol synthesis
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Pentose phosphate pathway, Cholesterol synthesis

questions.text: A person on fat free carbohydrate rich diet continues to grow obese . Which of the following lipoproteins is likely to be elevated?

A 6-month-old infant presents with motor weakness, exaggerated startle response, and a cherry-red spot on macular examination. Lab investigation reveal elevated levels of gangliosides in cells. Which inherited metabolic disorder is most likely responsible for this clinical presentation?

A young girl with a history of severe abdominal pain was taken to her local hospital at 5 a.m. in severe distress. Blood was drawn, and the plasma appeared milky, with the triacylglycerol level >2,000 mg/dl (normal = 4–150 mg/dl). Which of the following lipoprotein particles are most likely responsible for the appearance of the patient’s plasma?
How many ATPs are formed in case of stearic acid by beta oxidation?
β oxidation of fatty acids in peroxisomes ends with formation of
A 30-year-old male presents with enlarged, yellow-orange tonsils and reports intermittent episodes of neuropathy. Which of the following is a characteristic finding in his plasma lipoprotein profile?

options.label: C
options.text: Absent or extremely low HDL cholesterol

questions.correct_answer: C. Absent or extremely low HDL cholesterol
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Absent or extremely low HDL cholesterol

questions.text: The reaction: succinyl CoA + acetoacetate → Acetoacetyl CoA + succinate occurs in all of the following EXCEPT:
Compounds which inhibit the action of the recently discovered protein, proprotein convertase subtilisin/kexin type 9 (PCSK9), have been identified as a potential antiatherogenic drugs because PCSK9:

options.label: A
options.text: Decreases the number of LDL receptors exposed at the cell surface, thus LDL uptake is lowered and blood cholesterol levels rise.

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibits the binding of apo B to the LDL receptor, thus blocking uptake of the lipoprotein and raising blood cholesterol levels.

options.label: C
options.text: Increases the absorption of cholesterol from the intestine.

options.label: D
options.text: Increases the synthesis and secretion of VLDL in the liver, leading to increased LDL. formation in the blood.

questions.correct_answer: A. Decreases the number of LDL receptors exposed at the cell surface, thus LDL uptake is lowered and blood cholesterol levels rise.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Decreases the number of LDL receptors exposed at the cell surface, thus LDL uptake is lowered and blood cholesterol levels rise.

questions.text: A 23-yr lady has elevated BP on her routine checkup at 8 months gestation, and testing by her obstetrician demonstrates anemia with hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, and low platelets that are characteristic of HELLP syndrome. The female is hospitalized and fetal matu­rity tests are performed that allow elective premature delivery. The female quickly recovers but the premature newborn has a dilated heart and ele­vated liver enzymes that are characteristic of a defect in long chain fatty acid oxidation. The potential enzyme deficiencies are those responsible for sequential oxidation of fatty acids, which include which of the following?

A low level carbon dioxide labeled with C14 is accidentally released into the atmosphere surrounding industrial workers as they resume work following the lunch hour. Unknowingly, they breathe the contaminated air for 1 hour. Which of the following compounds will be radioactively labeled?

options.label: A
options.text: All of the carbon atoms of newly synthesized fatty acid

options.label: B
options.text: About one half of the carbon atoms of newly synthesized fatty acids

options.label: C
options.text: About one third of the carbons of newly synthesized malonyl CoA

options.label: D
options.text: One half of the carbon atoms of newly synthesized acetyl CoA

questions.correct_answer: C. About one third of the carbons of newly synthesized malonyl CoA
questions.explanation: Ans. C) About one third of the carbons of newly synthesized malonyl CoA

questions.text: Niemann-Pick disease, like other neurolipidoses, present in infancy or childhood with plateauing of development and neurologic regression. The accumulating substance is a phospholipid made in which of the following steps in the figure below?

A 45-year-old individual consumes a carbohydrate-rich meal. Several hours later, biochemical analysis reveals active fatty acid synthesis in the liver. Concurrently, a significant decrease in fatty acid β-oxidation is observed in mitochondria. Assertion: When the liver is actively synthesizing fatty acids in the fed state, there is a concomitant decrease in β-oxidation of fatty acids inside the mitochondria. Reason: Malonyl-CoA inhibits CPT-1, present at the outer mitochondrial membrane.

options.label: A
options.text: Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are correct, and R is the explanation of A.

options.label: B
options.text: Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are correct, but R is not the explanation of A.

options.label: D
options.text: Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are incorrect.

questions.correct_answer: A. Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are correct, and R is the explanation of A.

questions.text: A 50-year-old man presents with xanthomas and a history of premature coronary artery disease. His fasting lipid profile reveals elevated triglycerides and cholesterol levels. Lipoprotein electrophoresis shows an increase in chylomicrons and VLDL remnants. Genetic testing indicates a mutation in the ApoE gene. Which type of hyperlipoproteinemia does this patient most likely have?

A 45-year-old patient presents with symptoms of joint pain and inflammation. Laboratory tests reveal elevated levels of eicosanoids, which are derived from arachidonic acid. The doctor explains that arachidonic acid synthesis is essential for eicosanoid production in mammals. Which of the following processes leads to the synthesis of arachidonic acid in mammals?

options.label: B
options.text: Chain elongation and one desaturation of linolenic acid

options.label: C
options.text: Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid

questions.correct_answer: C. Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid

questions.text: An alpha helix of a protein is most likely to be disrupted if a missense mutation introduces the following amino acid within the alpha helical structure:
Which of the following is a technique to assess posttranslational modification of amino acid of peptides and proteins?

A 7-year-old boy is brought to the pediatric clinic with recurrent episodes of a photosensitive rash, intermittent diarrhea, and mood swings. His teacher has also reported difficulties in concentration at school. On examination, the child appears to have some cerebellar signs including coordination problems. Urinalysis shows an elevated excretion of neutral amino acids. Based on the findings, which amino acid deficiency is most characteristic of the child's likely inherited metabolic disorder?

A 7 months old baby was diagnosed with urea cycle disorder. Past H/O same disease in the previous baby and died at 1-year of age. Now what could be the rationale for feeding benzoic acids to subjects with a urea cycle enzyme defect:

options.label: A
options.text: It provides an alternative route for N2 excretion through glycine conjugate, hippuric acid

options.label: B
options.text: it provides an alternative route for N2 excretion through the N-acetyl glucuronic acid conjugate kynurenine

options.label: D
options.text: It neutralized NH3 in both blood as well as urine

questions.correct_answer: A. It provides an alternative route for N2 excretion through glycine conjugate, hippuric acid
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It provides an alternative route for N2 excretion through glycine conjugate, hippuric acid

questions.text: Which amino acid is responsible for flexibility of proteins:

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the hospital with episodes of irritability, vomiting, and rapid breathing. The mother mentions that the symptoms seemed to worsen after high-protein meals. Laboratory findings indicate elevated ammonia levels in the blood. Citrulline cannot be found in plasma amino acid analysis, however his urinary orotic acid level is elevated. Given the clinical picture and the boy's age, an inherited metabolic disorder is suspected. Which enzyme is defective?

A female neonate appeared healthy until age ~24 hours, when she became lethargic. A sepsis workup proved negative. At 56 hours, she started showing focal seizure activity. The plasma ammonia level was found to be 887 µmol/l (normal 5–35 µmol/l). Quantitative plasma amino acid levels revealed a marked elevation of citrulline but not argininosuccinate. Which one of the following enzymic activities is most likely to be deficient in this patient?
The vitamin that acts as a coenzyme of the given reaction is Serine + Homocysteine → Cystathionine + H₂O
Ingestion of benzoic acid in man result in an increase in urinary?
Which of the following would have no effect on the function of the protein product?

A 3-week-old infant is brought to the clinic because of unusual dark staining of the diapers after prolonged exposure to air. The parents initially thought this might be blood, but closer inspection revealed the discoloration to be black. The infant otherwise appears healthy with no feeding difficulties or developmental concerns. Urine examination reveals a markedly elevated level of homogentisic acid. Which metabolic pathway is affected in this disorder?

A child with a large head, multiple fractures, and blue scleras (whites of the eyes) is evaluated for osteogenesis imperfecta One study involves labeling of collagen chains in tissue culture to assess their mobility by gel electrophoresis. Amino acids labeled with radioactive carbon 14 are added to the culture dishes in order to label collagen. Which of the following amino acids would not result in labeled collagen?

An infant presented to the OPD with a history of vomiting and poor feeding. Musty odor is present in the baby's sweat and urine. Guthrie test was done and it was found to be positive. All are true regarding this disease except:

options.label: B
options.text: White patch of hair due to tryptophan deficiency

questions.correct_answer: B. White patch of hair due to tryptophan deficiency
questions.explanation: Ans. B) White patch of hair due to tryptophan deficiency

questions.text: Which of the following is a powerful qualitative and quantitative technique to assess molecular mass and primary amino acid sequence of peptides and proteins?

A 7-year-old child diagnosed with a urea cycle disorder presents with persistent hyperammonemia. As part of the management, phenylbutyrate is administered to help scavenge excess ammonia. The physician explains that phenylbutyrate acts by binding to a specific amino acid that donates its amino group to form a compound excreted in the urine, thereby lowering ammonia levels. Which amino acid donates the amino group to phenylbutyrate in this process?
Orotic acid –

options.label: A
options.text: React with PRPP to from OMP

options.label: C
options.text: Can be converted to UMP and CMP

questions.text: Taql is a restriction endonuclease commonly used to cut human DNA into pieces before inserting it into plasmid. Which of the following is most likely to be the recognition sequence for this enzyme.
Polyadenylation signal sequence is
Which of the following codon does not show degeneracy?
Primers are removed by all except

A molecular biologist is preparing to amplify a specific DNA segment using an enzyme catalyzed thermocycler-based reaction. Which of the following components if not included in reaction mixture will not affect the amplification process?

In a study on post-transcriptional gene silencing, an enzyme that processes precursor RNA into short double-stranded fragments was inhibited, leading to gene upregulation. Which of the following enzyme is inhibited?
Which one of the following is the complementary sequence of 5‘ TTAAGCTAC 3’?

A tRNA molecule that is supposed to carry cysteine (tRNA cys ) is mischarged so that it actually carries alanine (ala-tRNA cys ). Assuming no correction occurs, what will be the fate of this alanine residue during protein synthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: It will be incorporated into a protein in response to an alanine codon.

options.label: B
options.text: It will be incorporated into a protein in response to a cysteine codon.

options.label: C
options.text: It will remain attached to the tRNA as it cannot be used for protein synthesis.

options.label: D
options.text: It will be chemically convened to cysteine by cellular-enzymes.

questions.correct_answer: B. It will be incorporated into a protein in response to a cysteine codon.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It will be incorporated into a protein in response to a cysteine codon.

questions.text: A 10-year-old girl is brought by her parents to the dermatologist. She has many freckles on her face, neck, arms, and hands, and the parents report that she is unusually sensitive to sunlight. Two basal cell carcinomas are identified on her face. Based on the clinical picture, which of the following processes is most likely to be defective in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Repair of double-strand breaks by error-prone homologous recombination

options.label: B
options.text: Removal of mismatched bases from the 3′-end of Okazaki fragments by a methyl-directed process

options.label: C
options.text: Removal of pyrimidine dimers from DNA by nucleotide excision repair

options.label: D
options.text: Removal of uracil from DNA by base excision repair

questions.correct_answer: C. Removal of pyrimidine dimers from DNA by nucleotide excision repair
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Removal of pyrimidine dimers from DNA by nucleotide excision repair

questions.text: In SCID, what type of DNA repair is defective:

A lethal mutation occurs in a bacterium, rendering it incapable of replicating its chromosome. Because of this mutation, DNA synthesis produces many short fragments of DNA that have RNA sequences at their 5’ ends. The mutation is most likely in a gene encoding which of the following?
Which of the following is the name of a common organometallic DNA-binding motif?
Klenow fragment of prokaryotic DNA polymerase is?

options.label: A
options.text: Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

options.label: B
options.text: Large fragment of DNA Polymerase III, that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

options.label: C
options.text: Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' exonuclease, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' polymerase activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

questions.correct_answer: A. Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

questions.text: A patient presents with a genetic mutation in the coding sequence of a gene, where the codon for tyrosine is changed. Despite the mutation, the amino acid sequence of the protein remains unchanged. Which of the following codons could replace UAC (tyrosine) without altering the protein structure?
Restriction fragment length polymorphism analysis can only be used to follow the inheritance of a genetic disease if:

options.label: A
options.text: mRNA probe is used in combination with antibodies

options.label: B
options.text: The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to an restriction site

options.label: C
options.text: Mutation is outside of restriction sites so that cleaving still occurs

options.label: D
options.text: Restriction fragments remain the same size but their charge changes

questions.correct_answer: B. The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to an restriction site
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to an restriction site

questions.text: A 20-year-old anemic man was found to have an abnormal form of beta-globin chain that is 172 amino acid long rather than the 141 found in normal protein. Which of the following point mutation is consistent with this abnormality?

A culture of E.coli is grown in a medium containing glucose and lactose. The expression of the lactose operon over time in the cells is shown in the graph below. Which statement best describes the change that occurred t point A?

options.label: A
options.text: Lactose was added to the culture

options.label: B
options.text: cAMP concentration increased in the cells

options.label: C
options.text: Repressor protein dissociated from the operator

options.label: D
options.text: Repressor protein became bound to the operator

questions.correct_answer: B. cAMP concentration increased in the cells
questions.explanation: Ans. B) cAMP concentration increased in the cells

questions.text: Which one of the following is a cofactor and not a coenzyme?
True about RIBOZYME
Regulatory protein interact with DNA by all interaction except
Which of the following is true statement regarding the inhibitors in this graph?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibitor A decrease the affinity of enzyme for substrate

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibitor B decrease the affinity of enzyme for substrate

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibitor A decrease the Vmax of enzyme

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibitors A and B has no effect on enzyme kinetics parameters

questions.correct_answer: A. Inhibitor A decrease the affinity of enzyme for substrate
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Inhibitor A decrease the affinity of enzyme for substrate

questions.text: A 62-year-old male presents to the emergency department with severe chest pain radiating to the left arm, which began a few hours ago. An ECG indicates signs consistent with an acute myocardial infarction. While waiting for further management, a serum test is ordered, which reveals an abnormal LDH isoenzyme pattern. Which of the following best describes the expected LDH pattern seen in acute myocardial infarction?
Enzyme substrate interaction is mediated by all except:

A 58-year-old man underwent a total gastrectomy 2 years ago due to gastric carcinoma. He now presents with progressive numbness and tingling in his hands and feet, difficulty walking, and frequent falls. On neurological examination, he has diminished proprioception and vibration sense, positive Romberg sign, and hyperreflexia. Blood tests reveal macrocytic anemia and elevated methylmalonic acid levels. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Thiamine deficiency results in decreased energy production, because TPP_______.

options.label: C
options.text: Is coenzyme for pyruvate and alpha ketoglutarate dehydrogenase

options.label: D
options.text: Interferes with energy production from amino acids

questions.correct_answer: C. Is coenzyme for pyruvate and alpha ketoglutarate dehydrogenase
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Is coenzyme for pyruvate and alpha ketoglutarate dehydrogenase

questions.text: 30-year-old man presented at clinic with a history of intermittent abdominal pain and episodes of confusion and psychiatric problems. Laboratory tests revealed increases of urinary δ-aminolevulinate and porphobilinogen. Mutational analysis revealed a mutation in the gene for uroporphyrinogen I synthase (porphobilinogen deaminase). The probable diagnosis was:

A 15-month-old female child whose growth rate has been in the low over the last year presents with chronic, nonproductive cough for which she was prescribed antibiotics and taking for long time patient has diarrhea with foul-smelling stools. She is diagnosed as having cystic fibrosis. For which of the following vitamins is this child most likely to be at risk of deficiency?

A researcher is designing a genetic engineering experiment using recombinant DNA technology. The project involves cutting, modifying, and ligating DNA to create a specific genetic construct. Various enzymes are employed in this process, including those that modify DNA ends, cut DNA at specific sequences, and assist in editing DNA. Which of the following enzymes is NOT typically used in recombinant DNA technology?
Vitamin B1 is a cofactor in RBC for?

A 2-year-old child was brought to his pediatrician for evaluation of gastrointestinal problems. The parents report that the boy has been listless for the last few weeks. Lab tests reveal a microcytic, hypochromic anemia. Blood lead levels are elevated. Which of the enzymes listed below is most likely to have higher-than-normal activity in the liver of this child?

A 2-year-old boy presents with developmental delay, brittle hair, and frequent fractures. On physical examination, the child has loose skin and joint hypermobility. The physician suspects a genetic condition affecting copper metabolism, leading to reduced activity of lysyl oxidase, an enzyme essential for crosslinking collagen and elastin. Laboratory tests reveal low serum copper and ceruloplasmin levels. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Children with autism and other disorders with mental disability are often put on megavitamin supplements despite no scientific evidence of benefit. Although most vitamins are harmless in excess, merely being excreted in urine, vitamin A can be toxic. All of the following are symptoms of cither chronic or acute vitamin A toxicity except:
Histamine is produced from histidine by decarboxylation. The cofactor is:
Which is not Pyridoxine dependent
An enzyme involved in the catabolism of fructose to pyruvate in the liver is:
The patient had a history of strenous exercise but forgot to take his meal and later had alcohol in a party. Which of the following process is inhibited by alcohol
50-year-old man who drank too much alcohol fell in the street. He was quickly taken to the hospital. What is the first line treatment to be given to this patient in ER?
Cytosolic Cytochrome C mediates
Shine Dalgarno sequence in bacterial mRNA is

A pharmaceutical company is studying a new antibiotic that inhibits bacterial protein synthesis. When this antibiotic is added to an in vitro protein synthesis system that is translating the messenger RNA sequence AUGUUUUUUUAG, the only product formed is the dipeptide fMet-Phe. What step in protein synthesis is most likely inhibited by the antibiotic?

options.label: B
options.text: Binding of a charged transfer RNA to the ribosomal A site

questions.text: The initiator tRNA is placed within the active 80S complex at which of the three-canonical ribosomal "sites" during protein synthesis?
Which of the following is true about TIGAR?
